DataElement.preferredName: 6 Minute Walk Functional Test Restriction Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text response regarding the description of other restrictions or limiting factors on the Six Minute Walking Test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Bruno Blake in 1963, which is a performance-based evaluation of functional exercise capacity in subjects with chronic respiratory disease and heart failure, as well as other populations such as healthy older adults and people suffering from fibromyalgia and scleroderma. This functional test contains 6 items and measures the distance an individual is able to walk over a total of six minutes on a hard, flat surface._Anything that limits; a limitation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale developed by Bruno Blake in 1963, which is a performance-based evaluation of functional exercise capacity in subjects with chronic respiratory disease and heart failure, as well as other populations such as healthy older adults and people suffering from fibromyalgia and scleroderma. This functional test contains 6 items and measures the distance an individual is able to walk over a total of six minutes on a hard, flat surface.

This functional test contains 6 items and measures the distance an individual is able to walk over a total of six minutes on a hard, flat surface.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
